name: Universe, creation
description: Use this domain for general words referring to the physical universe. Some languages may not have a single word for the universe and may have to use a phrase such as 'rain, soil, and things of the sky' or 'sky, land, and water' or a descriptive phrase such as 'everything you can see' or 'everything that exists'.
questions: (1) What words refer to everything we can see?

subdomains.name: Sky
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the sky.
questions: (1) What words are used to refer to the sky?
(2) What words refer to the air around the earth?
(3) What words are used to refer to the place or area beyond the sky?
(4) What words describe something in the sky or something that happens in the sky?
(5) What words describe the appearance of the sky?
(6) What words refer to the edge of the sky where it meets the ground?
(7) What words refer to something in the sky?
(8) What words refer to the lights that appear in the northern (or southern) sky?
(9) What words refer to something being in the sky?

subdomains.name: Sun
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the sun. The sun does three basic things. It moves, it gives light, and it gives heat. These three actions are involved in the meanings of most of the words in this domain. Since the sun moves below the horizon, many words refer to it setting or rising. Since the sun is above the clouds, many words refer to it moving behind the clouds and the clouds blocking its light. The sun's light and heat also produce secondary effects. The sun causes plants to grow, and it causes damage to things.
questions: (1) What words refer to the sun?
(2) What words refer to how the sun moves?
(3) What words refer to the time when the sun rises?
(4) What words refer to the time when the sun is at its highest point?
(5) What words refer to the time when the sun sets?
(6) What words refer to when the sun is shining?
(7) What words refer to the sun shining through the clouds?
(8) What words describe where the sun is shining?
(9) What words describe when or where the sun doesn't shine?
(10) What words refer to the light of the sun?
(11) What words describe the brightness of the sun?
(12) What refer to the sun heating things?
(13) What else does the sun do?
(14) What words describe the damage done by sunlight?
(15) What do people use to protect themselves from the sun?
(16) What words are used of telling time by the sun?
(17) What words refer to using the power of the sun?

subdomains.name: Moon
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the moon. In your culture people may believe things about the moon. For instance in European culture people used to believe that the moon caused people to become crazy. So in English we have words like "moon-struck" and "lunatic." You should include such words in this domain.
questions: (1) What words refer to the moon?
(2) What words refer to how the moon moves?
(3) What words refer to the time when the moon rises?
(4) What words refer to the time when the moon sets?
(5) What words refer to when the moon is shining?
(6) What words describe where the moon is shining?
(7) What words describe when or where the moon doesn't shine?
(8) What words refer to the light of the moon?
(9) What words describe the brightness of the moon?
(10) What words describe the appearance of the moon?
(11) What words refer to the spots on the moon?
(12) What words refer to the phases of the moon?
(13) What words refer to the time it takes for the moon to go through its phases?

subdomains.name: Star
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the stars and other heavenly bodies.
questions: (1) What words are used to refer to the stars?
(2) What words describe the sky when the stars are shining?
(3) What words are used for where the stars are shining?
(4) What words are used for when or where the stars don't shine?
(5) What words refer to the light of the stars?
(6) What words describe the brightness of the stars?
(7) What words describe the appearance of the stars?
(8) What words refer to the study of the stars?
(9) What is a group of stars called?

subdomains.name: Planet
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to planets (large objects that circle the sun, looking like bright wandering stars in the sky), comets (objects that circle the sun, looking like a star with a tail), meteors (small objects that come from space and burn up when they hit the earth's atmosphere, causing a streak of light across the sky), and asteroids (small objects that circle the sun), planetary moons (large objects that circle the planets). Some cultures do not study the stars and will have few or no words in this domain. Others cultures that study the stars will have many words. There are only five planets that people can see in the sky--Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn. The others are only known from the scientific study of astronomy.
questions: (1) What words refer to a planet?
(2) What are the names of the planets?
(3) What words refer to how the planets move?
(4) What words refer to the sun and planets?
(5) What words refer to comets?
(6) What do comets do?
(7) What words refer to meteors?
(8) What do meteors do?
(9) What words are used for when a meteor hits the earth?
(10) What is a small planet called?

(2) What words refer to how much water is in the air?
(3) What words describe good air (such as when the air in a room is clean or doesn't smell bad)?
(4) What words describe bad air (such as when the air in a room is dirty, hot, smells bad, or too many people are breathing)?

(4) What words refer to keeping air out of something?
(5) What words refer to how much air is in something?

(7) What tools and machines are used to create or use the wind?

subdomains.name: Weather

subdomains.name: Wind
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the wind. Some words refer to when the wind begins and ends. The wind changes in speed, so some words refer to how fast the wind is moving. Try to rank these on a scale from very slow to very fast. These words may also be distinguished by what the wind does, since a fast wind does more things. These words may also be distinguished by how long the wind blows. Some words refer to the speed of the wind becoming faster or slower. Some words distinguish a steady wind from a wind in which the speed keeps changing. Some words refer to when the speed of the wind becomes faster for a short time. A steady wind moves in a particular direction, so there are words that include the direction of the wind. The direction of the wind may refer to the points of the compass, a neighboring geographical feature or area, or the direction in which the speaker is moving. Some words refer to a wind that moves in a small circle, making a pillar of dust or a funnel-shaped cloud. Some words refer to what the wind does, such as when it moves or damages something. People can feel the wind, so some words refer to how it feels. The wind makes noise, so there are words that refer to the sound of the wind. In some cultures there is a relation between the wind and spirits, so some words may refer to the activity of the spirits in the wind, or that the wind brings disease.
questions: (1) What general words refer to the wind?
(2) What words describe a wind that only lasts a short time?
(3) What words describe a steady wind?
(4) What words describe a wind that comes and goes?
(5) What words describe a strong wind?
(6) What words describe a light wind?
(7) What words describe a windstorm?
(8) What words refer to a wind that moves in a circle?
(9) What words refer to a warm or cold wind?
(10) What words describe when the wind begins?
(11) What words describe when the wind stops?
(12) What words describe the direction of the wind?
(13) What does the wind do?
(14) What words describe something being blown by the wind?
(15) What instruments are used to measure the direction or force of the wind?
(16) What sounds does the wind make?

subdomains.name: Plant
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words for all plants. Use a book of pictures to identify plant names and the scientific name. Languages divide plants into various domains that are not always comparable from language to language. Criterial features may be characteristics (trees and bushes are distinguished by size and number of trunks) and use (grass and weeds are distinguished by their desirability). A common distinction is between trees and non-trees, with trees described as being big, woody, and having a life expectancy of several years, while non-trees are small, non-woody, and have a life expectancy of typically not more than one year (Heine, Bernd and Karsten Legere. 1995. Swahili plants. Rudiger Koppe Verlag: Koln.). Agricultural societies will divide plants into wild and cultivated. However most plants for which there are names have some use. Therefore it does not seem helpful to divide plant names into domains for useful and non-useful plants. Since only parts of plants are eaten, edible parts of plants are listed under the domain 'Food'. Some languages may have more domains than are used in this list, others may have fewer. The classification system used here does not agree entirely with the system used by botanists. For instance botanists do not classify all the tree species together. The palm trees belong to the class Monocotyledoneae and are classified with lilies, bananas, and orchids. Apple and cherry trees belong to the class Dicotyledoneae and are classified in the rose family along with roses and blackberries. The acacia tree also belongs to the class Dicotyledoneae and is classified in the pulse family along with lupines and beans. However most folk taxonomies bring all the trees together. The scientific classification system for plants and animals is taken from: Carruth, Gorton, ed. 1989. The Volume Library, Vols. 1 and 2. The Southwestern Company: Nashville.
questions: (1) What words refer to all plants?
(2) What words describe types of plants?
(3) What words are used to describe plants that grow wild?
(4) What words refer to cultivated plants?
(5) What words refer to a group of plants?
(6) What words refer to the study of plants?

subdomains.name: Tree
subdomains.description: Use this domain for trees--flowering plants with roots, stems, and leaves, which are large and have a wooden trunk (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Angiospermae). Also include the evergreen trees (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Gymnospermae). Evergreen trees do not have flowers, but have cone like fruits (pinecones) that contain seeds. Their leaves are shaped like needles and are retained for over a year.
questions: (1) What general words refer to trees?
(2) What words refer to general types of trees?
(3) What types of trees are there?
(4) What types of trees are used for decoration?
(5) What words refer to a group of trees?

subdomains.name: Bush, shrub
subdomains.description: Use this domain for bushes and shrubs--plants that are smaller than trees and have several wooden trunks (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Angiospermae).
questions: (1) What general words refer to bushes?
(2) What types of bushes are there?

subdomains.name: Grass, herb, vine
subdomains.description: Use this domain for small plants that have roots, stems, flowers, and seeds, but do not have a wooden trunk (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Angiospermae). Also include the seedless plants, such as ferns (phylum Pteridophyta, class Felicineae), horsetails (phylum Pteridophyta, class Equisetineae), and club mosses (phylum Pteridophyta, class Lycopodineae). Plants of the Pteridophyta phylum have no flowers or seeds. Ferns have large, divided, feather-like leaves, or fronds. Club mosses are small (rarely over one meter) evergreen plants with simple leaves resembling pine or hemlock needles. Sometimes they grow upright, but often trail on the ground, where they propagate by means of runners. Horsetails send up tall, vertical, jointed stalks with branches covered with scale like leaves.

subdomains.name: Moss, fungus, algae
subdomains.description: Use this domain for mosses (phylum Bryophyta, class Musci), liverworts (phylum Bryophyta, class Hepaticae), fungi (phylum Thallophyta, subdivision Fungi), algae (phylum Thallophyta, subdivision Algae), and lichens. These plants do not have true roots, stems, or leaves. The mosses are small, green, flowerless plants that grow in moist environments and look like velvety or feathery growths carpeting the ground, tree trunks, and rocks. The liverworts are similar to the mosses with a flat and branching growth pattern. The algae possess green chlorophyll. They vary from one-celled organisms, which sometimes live in colonies such as pond scum, to complex organisms such as seaweed. The fungi do not possess chlorophyll and feed off of other organic material. Lichens consist of a fungus and an algae growing together. They commonly grow on trunks of trees and rocks. Some are flat and leafy, and some are moss like.

subdomains.name: Types of animals

This section is organized according to the scientific, biological classification of animals. It may not correspond to the local classification of animals (folk taxonomy), which are often based on how people relate to animals (tame/wild, edible/work). Use this domain for words referring to large classes of animals that do not correspond to the scientific classification. For instance this would be the place for a word like 'flying animal', which includes birds, bats, and flying insects.

For example some societies have been afraid that their women will be taken advantage of if these terms are known.

questions: (1) What words describe a person who is healthy?
(2) What words describe someone who is healthy and doesn't get sick?
(3) What words describe someone who looks healthy?
(4) What words refer to the state of being healthy?
(5) What words refer to a person's physical condition?
(6) What words describe something that makes you healthy?
(7) What words describe food that makes you healthy?

subdomains.name: Sick
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words describing a person who is sick.
questions: (1) What words refer to being sick?
(2) What words refer to being sick with a disease?
(3) What words refer to being a little sick?
(4) What words refer to being very sick?
(5) What words refer to feeling sick?
(6) What words describe a person who is sick?
(7) What words describe someone who is often sick?
(8) What words refer to becoming sick?
(9) What words refer to a person who is sick?
(10) What words refer to a time when many people are sick from the same disease?

subdomains.name: Recover from sickness
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to recovering from sickness or injury.
questions: (1) What words refer to recovering?
(2) What words refer to recovering from a disease?
(3) What words refer to no longer being very sick?
(4) What words refer to spending time resting in order to recover?
(5) What words refer to being healthy after being sick?
(6) What words refer to feeling good enough to do something?
(7) What words refer to a disease going away?
(8) What words refer to an injury healing?

subdomains.name: Disease
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words for disease and for words referring to specific diseases.
questions: (1) What words refer to a disease?
(2) What words refer to a disease that lasts a short time?
(3) What words describe a type of disease?
(4) What words describe a disease that kills people?
(5) What words describe a disease that people can get easily?
(6) What words refer to a disease spreading to other people?
(7) What are the names of particular diseases?
(8) What words refer to a disease of the brain or mind?
(9) What words refer to epilepsy?
(10) What words refer to a disease of the eyes?
(11) What words refer to a disease of the nose and throat?
(12) What words refer to a disease of the lungs?
(13) What words refer to a disease of the heart?
(14) What words refer to a disease of the liver?
(15) What words refer to sexually transmitted  disease?
(16) What words refer to a disease of the bones and joints?
(17) What words refer to cancer?

subdomains.name: Malnutrition, starvation
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to not having enough food.
questions: (1) What words refer to the condition produced by not having enough food?
(2) What words refer to dying from lack of food?
(3) What words describe someone who doesn't have enough food?

subdomains.name: Skin disease
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to skin diseases such as leprosy, boils, and rashes.
questions: (1) What words refer to a sore in the skin?
(2) What are the names of specific skin diseases?
(3) What words refer to having an infection?
(4) What words refer to an infection becoming worse?
(5) What words refer to a small sore in the skin?
(6) What words refer to pus?
(7) What does pus do?
(8) What words refer to a person with a skin disease?

subdomains.name: Stomach illness
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to stomach illness.
questions: (1) What words refer to being sick in your stomach?
(2) What types of stomach illness are there?
(3) What words refer to vomiting?
(4) What words refer to vomiting without bringing anything up?
(5) What are the symptoms of stomach illness?
(6) What words describe how you feel when your stomach is sick?
(7) What words refer to something making your stomach feel sick?

subdomains.name: Tooth decay
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to tooth decay.
questions: (1) What words are used to describe a tooth that has gone bad?
(2) What words refer to the pain caused by a bad tooth?
(3) What words refer to losing a tooth?
(4) What words refer to removing a tooth?
(5) What words refer to fixing a tooth?
(6) What words refer to false teeth?
(7) What words refer to a person who treats bad teeth?

subdomains.name: Injure
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to injuring someone.
questions: (1) What words refer to injuring someone?
(2) What words refer to injuring a part of your body?
(3) What words refer to injuring a bone or joint?
(4) What words refer to injuring a muscle?
(5) What words refer to being injured by being cut?
(6) What words refer to being injured by being hit?
(7) What words refer to being injured by being burned?
(8) What words refer to being injured?
(9) What words refer to someone who has been injured?
(10) What words refer to a person wounded in war?
(11) What words describe someone who has been injured?
(12) What words describe a part of your body that has been injured?
(13) What words refer to an injury?
(14) What words describe the seriousness of an injury?
(15) What words describe someone who is not injured?
(16) What words describe something that can injure someone?
(17) What words describe something that cannot injure someone?

subdomains.name: Amputate
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to amputating or losing a limb or other part of your body.
questions: (1) What words refer to the condition of having lost a limb?
(2) What words refer to the event or process that results in losing a limb?
(3) What words refer to a person who has lost a limb?
(4) What things are used by a person who has lost a limb?

subdomains.name: Poison
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to poison--something that is bad for your body if you eat it, it gets on you, or an animal injects it into you.
questions: (1) What general words refer to poison?
(2) What types of animal poisons are there?
(3) What types of plant poisons are there?
(4) What types of poison are eaten or drunk?
(5) What types of poison affect the skin?
(6) What words describe something that is poisonous?
(7) What words refer to giving someone poison?
(8) What words refer to an animal putting poison into a person?
(9) What words refer to treating snakebite?
(10) What words refer to treating poison that is eaten or drunk?

subdomains.name: Disabled
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words for being disabled--to be injured or born with a condition, so that some part of your body does not work.
questions: (1) What words refer to being disabled?
(2) What words refer to disabling someone?
(3) What words refer to the condition of being disabled?
(4) What words refer to a disabled person?
(5) What words describe someone who has been disabled?
(6) What things are used by a crippled person?

subdomains.name: Blind
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being blind.
questions: (1) What words describe someone who is blind?
(2) What words refer to becoming blind?
(3) What words refer to making someone blind?
(4) What words refer to a blind person?
(5) What words refer to the condition of being blind?
(6) What things are used by a blind person?

subdomains.name: Poor eyesight
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to having poor eyesight.
questions: (1) What words describe someone who cannot see well?
(2) What words refer to a disease that causes poor eyesight?
(3) What words refer to glasses?
(4) What words refer to wearing glasses?
(5) What words refer to a doctor who makes glasses?
(6) What words refer to the making of glasses?

subdomains.name: Deaf
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being deaf.
questions: (1) What words describe someone who is deaf?
(2) What words describe someone who is partially deaf?
(3) What words describe someone who is totally deaf?
(4) What words refer to a deaf person?
(5) What words refer to becoming deaf?
(6) What words refer to the condition of being deaf?
(7) What things are used by a deaf person?
(8) What words refer to a deaf person talking using their hands?
(9) What words refer to a deaf person understanding someone by watching their mouth?

subdomains.name: Mute
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being mute--unable to speak (usually because of being unable to hear).
questions: (1) What words refer to the condition of being mute?
(2) What words refer to a person who cannot speak?
(3) What things are used by the person who cannot speak?

subdomains.name: Birth defect
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to having a birth defect.
questions: (1) What words refer to something that is wrong with a baby?
(2) What words describe a deformed baby?
(3) What words refer to a deformed baby?
(4) What kinds of abnormalities are there?
(5) What words refer to giving birth to a deformed baby?

subdomains.name: Cause of disease
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to the cause of disease.
questions: (1) What words refer to the cause of a disease?
(2) What words refer to causing someone to be sick?
(3) What things cause disease?
(4) What words describe something that can make you sick?
(5) What words refer to finding the cause of a disease?

subdomains.name: Symptom of disease
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words for symptoms of disease--something that happens to you when you get sick, something that shows that you are sick.
questions: (1) What words refer to a symptom?
(2) What types of symptoms are there?
(3) What words refer to feeling weak?
(4) What words refer to the skin changing color due to illness?
(5) What words refer to itching when the skin is irritated?
(6) What words refer to coughing?
(7) What words refer to muscles cramping from pain?
(8) What words refer to the body shaking due to illness?
(9) What words refer to feeling dizzy or faint?

subdomains.name: Pain
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to pain
questions: (1) What words refer to pain?
(2) What words refer to being in pain?
(3) What words refer to a part of your body hurting?
(4) What words describe a part of your body that is in pain?
(5) What words refer to pain in a particular part of your body?
(6) What words refer to a mild pain?
(7) What words refer to a bad pain?
(8) What words describe pain increasing?
(9) What words describe pain decreasing?
(10) What words refer to a pain that increases and decreases repeatedly?
(11) What words refer to a pain that lasts a short time?
(12) What words refer to causing pain?
(13) What words refer to something causing pain?
(14) What words refer to relieving pain?
(15) What words refer to making noise because you are in pain?
(16) What words refer to moving because you are in pain?
(17) What do you say when you are hurt?
(18) What words refer to not causing pain?

subdomains.name: Fever
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to having a fever.
questions: (1) What words refer to having a fever?
(2) What words refer to a fever increasing?
(3) What words refer to a fever decreasing?
(4) What are the symptoms of having a fever?
(5) What words refer to measuring someone's fever?
(6) What instruments are used for measuring a fever?

subdomains.name: Swell
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to swelling of the body.
questions: (1) What words refer to swelling?
(2) What words refer to swelling in a particular part of the body?
(3) What words describe something that has swollen?
(4) What words refer to swelling increasing?
(5) What words refer to swelling decreasing?

subdomains.name: Lose consciousness
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to losing consciousness, including fainting, being knocked out, and anesthesia.
questions: (1) What words refer to being conscious?
(2) What words refer to losing consciousness?
(3) What words refer to the state of being unconscious?
(4) What words refer to something causing someone to lose consciousness?
(5) What words refer to regaining consciousness?
(6) What words refer to causing a person to regain consciousness?
(7) What words refer to a person who deals with loss of consciousness?
(8) What causes someone to lose consciousness?
(9) What happens or what symptoms occur when someone begins to lose consciousness?
(10) What are the symptoms of being unconscious?

subdomains.name: Dazed, confused
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words that describe the state of the mind when a person's mind is not working well or when he is not thinking very well.
questions: (1) What words refer to being dazed or confused?
(2) What words are used to express a slight case of these conditions?
(3) What words are used to express an extreme case of these conditions?
(4) What words describe a person's mind is working well?
(5) What words refer to causing someone to be dazed or confused?

subdomains.name: Vision, hallucination
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to having a vision--when a person sees something that isn't there because something unusual has happened to their mind. Include unusual, abnormal, and paranormal states of consciousness, visions, hallucinations, and spiritually induced trances.
questions: (1) What words refer to an unusual state of consciousness?
(2) What words refer to beginning an unusual state of consciousness?
(3) What words refer to the state of being in an unusual state of consciousness?
(4) What words refer to one person causing another to be in an unusual state of consciousness?
(5) What words describe regaining normal consciousness?
(6) What people deal with unusual states of consciousness?
(7) What causes someone to be in an unusual state of consciousness?

subdomains.name: Treat disease
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the treatment of disease and injury.
questions: (1) What words refer to treating someone who is sick or injured?
(2) What words refer to taking care of someone who is sick?
(3) What words refer to treating a disease?
(4) What words refer to a particular type of treatment?
(5) What words refer to treating a wound?
(6) What words refer to treating a broken bone?
(7) What words refer to surgery?
(8) What words refer to treating pain?
(9) What words refer to  things are done to treat disease?
(10) What words refer to trying to find out what is wrong with a sick person?
(11) What words refer to telling a sick person what to do in order to get well?
(12) What words refer to curing someone?
(13) What words refer to something that cures someone?
(14) What equipment is used to treat illness?
(15) What words refer to preventing disease?

subdomains.name: Doctor, nurse
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to people who habitually take care of the sick and injured, such as those who do it for a living.
questions: (1) What words refer to a person who takes care of the sick?
(2) What words refer to medical specialists and their branch of medicine?
(3) What words refer to a doctor who treats mental illness?
(4) What words refer to a doctor who treats teeth?
(5) What words refer to someone who helps a doctor?
(6) What words refer to someone who give emergency treatment to someone who has been injured?
(7) What words refer to a doctor who treats animals?
(8) What words refer to a person who pretends to be a doctor?
(9) What words refer to working as a doctor?
(10) What words refer to going to a doctor?

subdomains.name: Medicine
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to medicine, types of medicine, and the application of medicine.
questions: (1) What general words refer to medicine?
(2) What are the names of particular types of medicine?
(3) What words refer to medicine you put on your skin?
(4) What words refer to medicine that you eat or drink?
(5) What words refer to medicine that is injected under the skin?
(6) What words refer to giving medicine?
(7) What words refer to taking medicine?
(8) What words refer to some medicine that is given at one time?
(9) What words refer to the equipment used to store and administer medicine?
(10) What words refer to the written instructions a doctor gives about how much medicine to take?
(11) What words refer to someone who makes and sells medicine?

subdomains.name: Medicinal plants
subdomains.description: Use this domain for plants that are used for medicine.
questions: (1) What words refer to a plant that is used as a medicine?
(2) What plants are used as medicine?
(3) What words are used to describe the properties of these plants?

subdomains.name: Hospital
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words that refer to a place where the sick and injured are treated.
questions: (1) What words refer to a place where the sick and injured are treated?
(2) What words refer to a hospital for people who are mentally ill?
(3) What are the parts of a hospital?
(4) What words refer to a place where medicine is kept or given out?
(5) What words refer to a vehicle for transporting the injured?
(6) What words refer to putting someone in the hospital?
(7) What words refer to a sick person in a hospital?
(8) What words refer to being a patient in a hospital?

subdomains.name: Traditional medicine
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to traditional medicine. There may be no distinction in terminology between 'modern medicine' and 'traditional medicine.' In that case this domain should be ignored. (Our purpose here is not to judge the value of traditional medicine, but to collect and describe the words used for it.)
questions: (1) What words refer to the practice of traditional medicine?
(2) What words refer to the types of treatment?
(3) What words refer to a person who practices traditional medicine?
(4) What words refer to the medicine used in traditional medicine?

subdomains.name: Mental illness
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being mentally ill or disabled.
questions: (1) What words describe someone who is mentally ill?
(2) What words describe an old person who has become mentally ill?
(3) What words refer to mental illness?
(4) What words refer to becoming mentally ill?
(5) What words refer to something that causes mental illness?
(6) What words refer to partial or total mental disability?
(7) What words refer to a mentally ill person?
(8) What words refer to someone who cares for mentally ill people?
(9) What words refer to a hospital for mentally ill people?
(10) What words refer to someone who is normal and not mentally ill?

subdomains.name: Life
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words referring to being alive and to a person's lifetime.
questions: (1) What words refer to being alive?
(2) What words describe someone who is alive?
(3) What words refer to the process a person goes through from birth to death?
(4) What words refer to the time when a person is alive?
(5) What words refer to causing someone to be alive?
(6) What words refer to bringing a dead person back to life?
(7) What words refer to keeping someone alive?
(8) What words refer to living longer than someone else?
(9) What words refer to having a particular kind of life?
(10) What words refer to the kind of life a person lives?
(11) What words indicate that something is true of your whole life?

subdomains.name: Marriage
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the state of being married.
questions: (1) What words refer to marrying someone?
(2) What words refer to the state of being married?
(3) What words refer to being married to someone?
(4) What words refer to people who are married?
(5) What words are used of the relationship between a husband and wife?
(6) What words refer to marrying again after being widowed or divorced?
(7) What words refer to marrying more than one person?
(8) What words refer to marrying only one person?
(9) What words refer to marrying someone from another tribe or race?
(10) What words refer to living with someone without being married?
(11) What words refer to marrying a close relative?
(12) What words refer to marrying your brother's widow?
(13) What words describe something having to do with marriage?

subdomains.name: Arrange a marriage
subdomains.description: Use this domain for all the words related to arranging a marriage. Cultures vary widely in their practices. In some cultures marriages are arranged by the parents. In other cultures a man must seek a wife for himself. Some cultures allow either practice or a combination of the two. So some of the questions below may be inappropriate to your culture.
questions: (1) What words refer to the process of arranging a marriage?
(2) What words refer to asking someone to marry you?
(3) What words refer to formally agreeing to get married?
(4) What words refer to an announcement of a proposed marriage?
(5) What words refer to the state of being engaged to be married?
(6) What words refer to the people who are engaged to be married?
(7) What words refer to a person who helps with the negotiations?
(8) What words refer to a gift or payment given to your future spouse or their family?
(9) What words refer to a man trying to get a woman to marry him?
(10) What words refer to the age at which a person can get married?
(11) What words refer to marrying secretly?

subdomains.name: Wedding
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the wedding ceremony.
questions: (1) What words refer to a wedding ceremony?
(2) What words refer to getting married secretly?
(3) What are the parts of a wedding ceremony?
(4) What words refer to the people who are getting married?
(5) What other people are involved in a wedding?
(6) What words refer to performing a wedding ceremony?
(7) What words refer to the person who performs a wedding ceremony?
(8) What special clothes are worn at a wedding?
(9) What things are used in a wedding?
(10) What words refer to the time immediately after the wedding?
(11) What words refer to the husband and wife after the wedding?
(12) What words refer to the day of a wedding which is celebrated every year?

subdomains.name: Unmarried
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being unmarried.
questions: (1) What words refer to being unmarried?
(2) What words refer to a woman who is unmarried?
(3) What words refer to a man who is unmarried?

subdomains.name: Divorce
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to divorce--to legally end your marriage.
questions: (1) What words refer to divorcing your wife or husband?
(2) What words refer to a divorce?
(3) What words refer to a person who has been divorced?
(4) What words describe someone who has been divorced?
(5) What words refer to a judge ending a marriage?
(6) What words refer to the legal process of divorcing your wife or husband?
(7) What words refer to leaving your husband or wife?
(8) What words refer to when a husband and wife no longer live together?
(9) What words indicate who keeps the children?

subdomains.name: Romantic love
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to romantic love.
questions: (1) What words refer to loving someone?
(2) What words refer to starting to love someone?
(3) What words refer loving someone very much?
(4) What words refer to the feeling of love?
(5) What words describe something someone says or does when they love someone?
(6) What words refer to someone you love?
(7) What words refer to doing something with someone you love?
(8) What do people call someone that they love?
(9) What words refer to problems between people who love each other?
(10) What words refer to loving each other again after having problems?

subdomains.name: Sexual relations
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to sexual relations and having sex. Be careful that your domain label does not use a taboo word.
questions: (1) What general words refer to sexual relations?
(2) What words refer to having sex with someone?
(3) What words refer to affection and sexual stimulation?
(4) What words refer to orgasm?
(5) What words describe something having to do with sex?
(6) What words describe someone who wants to have sex?
(7) What words refer to something used to increase sexual pleasure?
(8) What words refer to two people who are having sex?
(9) What words describe a person who has difficulty having sex?
(10) What words refer to being friends, but not having sex?

subdomains.name: Virginity
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being a virgin--a person who has never had sex.
questions: (1) What words refer to a person who has never had sex?
(2) What words refer to maintaining your virginity?
(3) What words refer to no longer being a virgin?

subdomains.name: Attract sexually
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to attracting someone sexually--to cause someone to want to have sex with you, and for words related to being sexually attracted to someone--to want to have sex with someone.
questions: (1) What words refer to attracting someone sexually?
(2) What words refer to being sexually attracted to someone?
(3) What words refer to wanting to have sex?
(4) What words refer to the feeling of being sexually attracted?
(5) What words describe someone who is sexually attractive?
(6) What words describe something someone does to attract someone?
(7) What words refer to a quality a person has that makes them attractive?
(8) What words describe someone who is not attractive?

subdomains.name: Sexual immorality
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to illicit sexual relations.
questions: (1) What general words refer to sexual immorality?
(2) What words refer to someone who is sexually immoral?
(3) What words describe someone who is sexual immoral?
(4) What words refer to sex before marriage?
(5) What words refer to sexual offenses within a marriage?
(6) What words refer to sex with a person you are not married to?
(7) What words refer to a person who commits adultery?
(8) What words refer to tempting someone to have sex outside of marriage?
(9) What words refer to an ongoing relationship outside of marriage?
(10) What words refer to a single time of adultery?
(11) What words refer to having sex with many people?
(12) What words refer to a prostitute?
(13) What words refer to what prostitutes do?
(14) What words refer to having sex by yourself?
(15) What words describe books and movies that are about sex?
(16) What words refer to sex between close relatives?
(17) What words refer to forcing a woman to have sex?
(18) What words refer to sex between two people of the same sex?
(19) What words refer to having sex with a child?
(20) What words refer to sex with an animal?

subdomains.name: Birth
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to giving birth and being born.
questions: (1) What words refer to a mother giving birth?
(2) What words refer to a baby being born?
(3) What words refer to the event of giving birth?
(4) What are the steps or stages in giving birth?
(5) What words refer to what is done for the baby?
(6) What words describe something to do with birth?
(7) What words refer to the entire process of producing a baby?
(8) What words refer to having your first baby?

subdomains.name: Pregnancy
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being pregnant.
questions: (1) What words refer to a man causing a woman to become pregnant?
(2) What words refer to a woman becoming pregnant?
(3) What words refer to a woman being pregnant?
(4) What words describe a woman who is pregnant?
(5) What words refer to the time period when a woman is pregnant?
(6) What words refer to what a baby does?
(7) What words refer to the part from the father and the part from the mother that make a baby?

subdomains.name: Fetus
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a fetus--a baby that has not been born yet.
questions: (1) What words refer to an unborn baby?
(2) What words refer to the parts that surround a baby and connect it to its mother's womb?

subdomains.name: Miscarriage
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the prevention or termination of a pregnancy, and for words related to killing babies.
questions: (1) What words refer to preventing pregnancy?
(2) What things are used to prevent pregnancy?
(3) What words refer to a baby dying before birth?
(4) What words refer to killing a baby before birth?
(5) What words refer to killing a baby after birth?

subdomains.name: Labor and birth pains
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to labor and birth pains.
questions: (1) What general words refer to the process leading up to birth?
(2) What words refer to the feelings a woman has when she thinks she is beginning to go into labor?
(3) What are the signs that a woman is going into labor?
(4) What words refer to the contractions of the muscles of the uterus?
(5) What words refer to labor pains?
(6) What do women do while suffering birth pains?

subdomains.name: Help to give birth
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to helping a woman to give birth.
questions: (1) What words refer to giving help to a woman who is giving birth?
(2) What words refer to a doctor operating on a woman to deliver a baby?
(3) What words refer to a person who helps to give birth?
(4) What materials and instruments are used by obstetricians and midwives?

subdomains.name: Unusual birth
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to an unusual birth.
questions: (1) What words refer to giving birth early?
(2) What words refer to a difficult birth?
(3) What words refer to a mother who dies while giving birth?

subdomains.name: Multiple births
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to multiple births--when a woman give birth to more than one baby at the same time.
questions: (1) What words refer to the number of babies born at the same time?

subdomains.name: Fertile, infertile
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being unable to have children.
questions: (1) What words refer to having many children?
(2) What words refer to being able to have children?
(3) What words refer to being unable to have children?

subdomains.name: Birth ceremony
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a birth ceremony.

subdomains.name: Be about, subject

Verbs of thinking, knowing, or speaking (including other types of expression) can take a 'topic' role. We can think of a 'topic' as the main idea. Use this domain also for the important thing in a picture.

subdomains.name: Obscenity
subdomains.description: Use this domain for obscene words related to sex, defecation, death, damnation, and other taboo or offensive subjects. It is important to check the appropriateness of including obscene words in the dictionary. It should be the choice of the speakers of the language whether a word should be included or excluded. Obscene words included in the dictionary should be clearly marked as such. Obscenity is often used to heighten the emotion of an expression, and is often used when someone is angry. Obscenity is often associated with sex or defecation. Cursing is often associated with God, religion, or the afterlife. Insults often involve equating a person with an animal that is associated with an undesirable characteristic, questioning someone's parentage/legitimacy, questioning someone's character, or questioning someone's intelligence/sanity.
questions: (1) What words refer to speech that is considered offensive or improper?
(2) What words refer to using obscenity?
(3) What words are used in an obscene way?
(4) What words describe speech or actions that are obscene?
(5) What words describe someone who uses obscenities a lot?
