questions: (1) What words refer to being at peace?
(2) What words refer to the state of peace or the lack of fighting between people?
(3) What words describe the state of peace?
(4) What words refer to becoming peaceful?
(5) What words refer to keeping the peace?

subdomains.name: Rebuke
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to rebuking someone--to tell someone that he has done something wrong.
questions: (1) What words refer to someone telling another that he has done wrong?

subdomains.name: Make an appeal
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to making an appeal.
questions: (1) What words refer to one person asking another to do what is good?
(2) What words refer to someone urging another to do what is good?

subdomains.name: Appease
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to appeasing someone.
questions: (1) What words refer to someone giving something to another to cause him to do something?
(2) What words refer to this act or practice?
(3) What words refer to the gift?

subdomains.name: Negotiate
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to negotiating with someone.
questions: (1) What words refer to two people trying to reach an agreement?
(2) What words refer to the process two people trying to reach an agreement?

subdomains.name: Renounce claim, concede
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to renouncing a claim.
questions: (1) What words refer to renouncing a claim?

subdomains.name: Repent
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to repenting.
questions: (1) What words indicate that a person recognizes he has done wrong?
(2) What words indicate that a person has decided to change his behavior?
(3) What words refer to a decision to change?
(4) What words refer to an admission of wrong?
(5) What words refer to a request for forgiveness?
(6) What words refer to an effort to make up for doing wrong?
(7) What do people say when they ask for forgiveness?

subdomains.name: Request forgiveness
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to asking for forgiveness.
questions: (1) What words refer to requesting forgiveness?

subdomains.name: Forgive
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to forgiving someone.
questions: (1) What words refer to forgiving someone?

subdomains.name: Make peace
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to making peace--to try to prevent or end a war.
questions: (1) What words refer to trying to prevent or end a war?
(2) What words refer to ending a war with your enemies?

subdomains.name: Stop fighting
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to stopping fighting.
questions: (1) What words refer to stopping fighting?
(2) What words refer to talking about stopping fighting?
(3) What words refer to an agreement to stop fighting?

subdomains.name: Reconcile
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to reconciling with someone.
questions: (1) What words refer to enemies becoming reconciled?

subdomains.name: Religion
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words referring to religion and the supernatural.
questions: (1) What words refer to the system of belief and practice related to God?
(2) What words refer to what is beyond our senses or ability?
(3) What words describe something having to do with religion?
(4) What words refer to those areas of life outside of religion?
(5) What words refer to the world of gods and spirits?

subdomains.name: God
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to God--the supreme being in the universe. Each theological system will have different beliefs concerning the existence and nature of God. Our purpose here is to collect and define the terms used to refer to the supreme deity. If there is no such person in the theological system, then use this domain for other terms for the pantheon of gods, ultimate reality, nirvana, and similar concepts. However most theological systems, even atheism, have the concept of a supreme God and use words to refer to him.
questions: (1) What words refer to the supreme being in the universe?
(2) What words refer to what people believe about God?
(3) What words describe something to do with God?

subdomains.name: Supernatural being
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to supernatural beings--gods, spirits, other types of beings, which normally cannot be seen and do not belong to this world. Some people accept the existence of certain supernatural beings and not others. Mythological beings are those that were believed in during previous times but that are no longer believed in. Fictional beings are those that no one has ever believed in. An indication of whether most people believe in the supernatural being should be put in the definition.
questions: (1) What general words refer to supernatural beings?
(2) What words refer to lesser gods?
(3) What types of good supernatural beings are there?
(4) What types of evil supernatural beings are there?
(5) What words refer to the spirit of a dead person?
(6) What words refer to supernatural beings that are considered to be mythological or fictional and not real?
(7) What words describe something like or related to a supernatural being?

subdomains.name: Theology
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to theology--the study of God and what people believe about God.
questions: (1) What words refer to the study of God and religion?
(2) What words refer to something you believe about God?
(3) What words refer to disagreement over doctrine?
(4) What words refer to foolish or ignorant beliefs about religion?

subdomains.name: Sacred writings
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to sacred writings. Examples are only given for the Christian sacred writings. However you should include words referring to the holy books of all religions .
questions: (1) What words refer to sacred writings?
(2) What words refer to a part of the sacred writings?
(3) What words refer to God's role in producing sacred writings?
(4) What words describe the sacred writings or a text from the sacred writings?
(5) What words describe whether or not a book should be considered a part of the sacred writings?
(6) What words refer to a book that is revered but not considered part of the sacred writings?
(7) What words refer to the interpretation of sacred writings?
(8) What words refer to a book that interprets the sacred writings?

subdomains.name: Miracle, supernatural power
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to miracles--the use of supernatural power to do something good.
questions: (1) What words refer to supernatural power?
(2) What words refer to performing a miracle?
(3) What words refer to the event of a miracle?
(4) What words describe a miracle?
(5) What words refer to a person who can perform miracles?

subdomains.name: Sorcery
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to sorcery--the use of supernatural power to do something bad.
questions: (1) What words refer to doing something using sorcery?
(2) What words refer to the practice of sorcery?
(3) What words refer to something that someone does using sorcery?
(4) What is a person called who practices sorcery?
(5) What words describe someone or something that can do magic?
(6) What words describe someone who has been bewitched?
(7) What words refer to protecting someone from sorcery?
(8) What things are used when performing sorcery?
(9) What words are used when performing sorcery?
(10) What words refer to malevolent supernatural power?

subdomains.name: Demon possession
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to demon possession--when a demon or spirit influences or controls the behavior of a person. Use this domain for all words related to the relationship between spirits and people, including communication between people and spirits. Also use this domain for words referring to casting out demons--causing a demon to stop influencing or controlling a person.
questions: (1) What words refer to being influenced or controlled by a demon?
(2) What words refer to what demons do to people?
(3) What words refer to casting out a demon?
(4) What words refer to a person who casts out demons?

subdomains.name: Bless
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to blessing someone--saying something that causes something good to happen, or requests God to do something good to someone.
questions: (1) What words refer to blessing someone?
(2) What words refer to what is said in blessing?

subdomains.name: Curse
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to cursing someone.
questions: (1) What words refer to cursing someone?
(2) What words refer to the curse place on someone?

subdomains.name: Destiny
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to destiny--decisions and actions by God, spirits, or by impersonal forces that determine or influence what happens to a person.
questions: (1) What words refer to the decisions God makes concerning what happens to a person?
(2) What words refer to an impersonal force that determines what happens to a person?
(3) What words refer to something to which a person or thing is destined?

subdomains.name: Prophecy
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to speaking for God, including foretelling the future through divine knowledge.
questions: (1) What words refer to being able to speak for God or deliver a message from God?
(2) What words refer to what is said?
(3) What is a person called who speaks for God or foretells the future?
(4) What words describe something said in prophecy?

subdomains.name: Omen, divination
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to supernatural knowledge.
questions: (1) What words refer to supernatural knowledge?
(2) What words refer to being able to divine secrets?
(3) What words refer to the practice of divining secrets?
(4) What is a person called who can divine secrets?
(5) What words describe someone who can divine secrets?
(6) What words refer to something showing what will happen in the future?
(7) What words refer to something that shows or tells a secret?
(8) What methods are used to divine secrets?

subdomains.name: Practice religion
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to practicing religion.
questions: (1) What words refer to practicing religion?

subdomains.name: Devout
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being devout.
questions: (1) What words describe someone who practices his religion with devotion?
(2) What words describe someone who is not devout?

subdomains.name: Pray
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to praying--talking to God.
questions: (1) What words refer to praying to God?
(2) What words refer to prayer?
(3) What actions or postures symbolize prayer?

subdomains.name: Worship
subdomains.description: Use this domain for personal expressions of devotion to God, in whatever ways the religion defines and expresses it.
questions: (1) What words refer to relating to God or to the spirits?
(2) What words refer to acts of worship toward God?
(3) What words refer to the act of worship?
(4) What actions or postures symbolize worship?
(5) What types of actions make up worship?

subdomains.name: Religious ceremony
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to religious ceremonies.
questions: (1) What words refer to performing a religious ceremony?
(2) What words refer to a religious ceremony?

subdomains.name: Offering, sacrifice
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to offering a sacrifice.
questions: (1) What words refer to offering a sacrifice?
(2) What words refer to offering a sacrifice?
(3) What words refer to what is sacrificed?
(4) What words describe a sacrifice?

subdomains.name: Religious purification
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to religious purification.
questions: (1) What words refer to purifying someone or something for religious purposes?
(2) What words describe something that has been purified?
(3) What words describe something that has not been purified?
(4) What words refer to something that causes impurity?

subdomains.name: Taboo
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to things that are taboo--something to be avoided; a religious, social, or cultural restriction on behavior, as opposed to a government law.
questions: (1) What words refer to a cultural restriction on behavior?
(2) What words refer to making something taboo?
(3) What words describe something that is taboo?

subdomains.name: Salvation
subdomains.description: Use this domain for the primary goal or goals of a religion, for instance in Christianity salvation from sin, death and Hell. Each religion has different beliefs about salvation. Our purpose here is not to preach or argue, but to list those words that people use to talk about this topic.
questions: (1) What words refer to what God does to save a person?
(2) What words refer to a person who saves another?
(3) What words refer to what a person does to be saved?

subdomains.name: Dedicate to religious use
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to dedicating someone or something to religious use.
questions: (1) What words refer to dedicating something to religious use?
(2) What words describe something that has been dedicated?
(3) What words describe something that has not been dedicated?
(4) What words refer to improperly using something that has been dedicated?

subdomains.name: Fasting
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to fasting--to not eat for a period of time.
questions: (1) What words refer to not eating for a period of time?
(2) What words refer to a person who denies himself for religious purposes?
(3) What words refer to the general practice of denying oneself something?
(4) What words refer to a time when a person fasts or denies himself in some other way?

subdomains.name: Heaven, hell
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to heaven and hell--the place where people go after they die.
questions: (1) What is the place or home of God called?
(2) What is the place called where dead people are?
(3) What is the place called where believers (good people) go when they die?
(4) What is the place called where unbelievers (bad people) go when they die?
(5) What words refer to going to heaven or hell?
(6) What words describe something belonging to heaven or hell?

subdomains.name: Resurrection
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to resurrection--life after death, or living again after dying.
questions: (1) What words refer to coming back to life?
(2) What words refer to causing someone to come back to life?
(3) What words refer to the condition or state of living forever?
(4) What words refer to reincarnation?

subdomains.name: Religious organization
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to official religions, groups within a religion, and religious meetings. Each religion will have different names for its groups. Answer each question for each religion.
questions: (1) What general words refer to an official religion?
(2) What are the names of the official religions?
(3) What words refer to a group within a religion?
(4) What are the names of the sects?
(5) What words refer to a group of believers in a particular place?
(6) What words refer to beginning to believe in a religion or changing from one religion to another?

subdomains.name: Religious person
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to religious practitioners--people who practice a religion, who are members of the religion, believe in the religion, leaders of the religion, and followers of the religion. Each religion has its own terms for religious practitioners. List these terms separately for each religion. The examples given below are for the Christian religion.
questions: (1) What is a person called who believes in a religion?
(2) What is a person called who believes in the (Christian) religion?
(3) What is a leader of the (Christian-Protestant) religion called?
(4) What is a leader of the (Christian-Catholic) religion called?
(5) What words refer to the profession of being a religious leader?
(6) What words refers to all religious leaders?
(7) What words refer to followers of a religion who are not leaders?

subdomains.name: Christianity
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words used in Christianity.
questions: (1) What words are used to talk about Christianity?

subdomains.name: Islam
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words used in Islam.
questions: (1) What words are used to talk about Islam?

subdomains.name: Hinduism
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words used in Hinduism.
questions: (1) What words are used to talk about Hinduism?

subdomains.name: Buddhism
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words used in Buddhism.
questions: (1) What words are used to talk about Buddhism?

subdomains.name: Judaism
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words used in Judaism.
questions: (1) What words are used to talk about Judaism?

subdomains.name: Animism
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words used in Animism--the belief in spirits.
questions: (1) What words are used to talk about Animism?
(2) What words refer to someone who believes in Animism?

subdomains.name: Religious things
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a religious object.
questions: (1) What types of religious objects are there?
(2) What words refer to objects with supernatural power?
(3) What words refer to clothes worn by priests and other religious people?

subdomains.name: Idol
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to idols and their use.
questions: (1) What words refer to an object that represents a god?
(2) What words refer to the practice of making and worshiping idols?

subdomains.name: Place of worship
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to places of worship. Each religion has different types of places of worship. These questions must be answered according to the practices of each religion and for each separate type of place.
questions: (1) What words refer to a place that is dedicated to God?
(2) What are the parts of a church?
(3) What are the parts of a temple?
(4) Where are idols placed?
(5) Where do religious leaders live?

subdomains.name: Irreligion
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to thinking and acting against God or religion.
questions: (1) What is a person called who does not believe in a religion?
(2) What words refer to a religious group, which the official religion considers to be false?
(3) What words refer to a belief, which the official religion considers to be false?
(4) What words refer to thinking against God?
(5) What words refer to speaking against God?
(6) What words refer to acting against God?
(7) What words describe someone who is against God?
(8) What words refer to turning away from God?
(9) What words refer to pretending to be religious?
(10) What words refer to extreme beliefs that are evil?
(11) What words refer to religious practices that are done in ignorance?
(12) What words refer to allowing other people to practice their religion?

name: Daily life
description: Use this domain for words related to daily life at home.
questions: (1) What words refer to daily life?

subdomains.name: Household equipment
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to household equipment and tools.
questions: (1) What general words refer to the things in a house?
(2) What kinds of things are used to provide light in a house?
(3) What things are used to clean a house?
(4) What things are used to provide water?
(5) What kinds of things are used to heat or cool a house?
(6) What other kinds of things are commonly found in a house?

subdomains.name: Furniture
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to furniture.
questions: (1) What general words refer to furniture?
(2) What words refer to putting furniture in a house?
(3) What words refer to floor coverings?

subdomains.name: Table
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a table.
questions: (1) What types of tables are there?
(2) What are the parts of a table?
(3) What do people commonly put on top of a table that is closely associated with the table?

subdomains.name: Chair
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a chair.
questions: (1) What kinds of chairs are there?
(2) What are the parts of a chair?

subdomains.name: Bed
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a bed.
questions: (1) What kinds of beds are there?
(2) What covers are put on a bed?
(3) What do people do with beds?

subdomains.name: Cabinet
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a cabinet.
questions: (1) What kinds of cabinets are there?
(2) What do people do with cabinets?

subdomains.name: Household decoration
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to household decorations.
questions: (1) What things are used to decorate a house?

subdomains.name: Food
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words referring to food.
questions: (1) What general words refer to food?

subdomains.name: Food preparation
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to food preparation.
questions: (1) What words refer to preparing food?
(2) What words refer to the person who prepares food and cooks?
(3) What words refer to a person who prepares special types of food?
(4) What words refer to the thing that is cooked?
(5) What words refer to the place where food is prepared and cooked?
(6) What words describe how well a person cooks?
(7) What words describe how thoroughly something has been cooked?
(8) What words refer to a set of instructions for cooking something?

subdomains.name: Cooking methods
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to various ways of cooking food. It is necessary to think through different kinds of food and how they are cooked. An example is given below for cooking eggs.
questions: (1) What words refer to various ways of cooking food?
(2) What ways can you cook an egg?
(3) What words describe something that has been cooked?
(4) What words describe something that is being cooked?

subdomains.name: Steps in food preparation
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the steps in food preparation. One way to find the words in this domain is to describe how each type of food is prepared.
questions: (1) What are the steps in preparing food?
(2) What words refer to cutting up ingredients?
(3) What words refer to mixing ingredients?
(4) What words refer to allowing food to ripen?

subdomains.name: Remove shell, skin
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to removing the shell or skin from food.
questions: (1) What words refer to removing the shell or skin from food?

subdomains.name: Pound in mortar and pestle
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to pounding food in a mortar.
questions: (1) What words refer to pounding food in a mortar?

subdomains.name: Grind flour
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to grinding flour.
questions: (1) What words refer to grinding flour?
(2) What words refer to the grain before it is ground?
(3) What words refer to the flour after it is ground?
(4) What tools are used to grind flour?

subdomains.name: Cooking utensil
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to cooking utensils.
questions: (1) What general words refer to cooking utensils?
(2) What utensils are used to cut food?
(3) What utensils are used to break up and crush food?
(4) What utensils are used to move, stir, mix and turn food?
(5) What containers are used to mix food?
(6) What utensils are used to measure ingredients?
(7) What utensils are used to handle hot pans?
(8) What containers are used to cook food?
(9) What appliances are used to cook food?
(10) What appliances are used to store food?
(11) What are the parts of these utensils?

subdomains.name: Food storage
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to food preservation and storage.
questions: (1) What words refer to preserving food?
(2) What methods and materials are used to preserve food?
(3) What words refer to storing food?
(4) What containers are used to store food?

subdomains.name: Serve food
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to serving food.
questions: (1) What words refer to serving food?
(2) Who serves food?
(3) What is a piece of food called?
(4) What is the best piece called?
(5) What utensils are used to serve food?
(6) Where is food served?

subdomains.name: Eat
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to eating.
questions: (1) What general words refer to eating food?
(2) What words refer to licking with the tongue?
(3) What words refer to swallowing?
(4) What words refer to difficulty in swallowing?
(5) What words refer to feeding someone?

subdomains.name: Bite, chew
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to biting and chewing with the teeth.
questions: (1) What words refer to biting something?
(2) What words refer to biting someone?
(3) What words refer to a wound caused by an animal biting you?
(4) What words refer to chewing?
(5) What refer to grinding your teeth together?
(6) What words refer to swallowing?

subdomains.name: Meal
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a meal.
questions: (1) What general words refer to a time when people eat?
(2) What words refer to a meal eaten at a particular time of day?
(3) What words refer to the main meal of the day?
(4) What words refer to a small meal?
(5) What words refer to a meal eaten outside?
(6) What words refer to eating a meal?
(7) What do people say at the beginning of a meal?
(8) What do people say when they want something?
(9) What do people say when they are done eating?

subdomains.name: Feast
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a feast.
questions: (1) What words refer to a large or important meal?
(2) What are the parts of a feast?
(3) Who is the leader of a feast?
(4) Who is invited to a feast?
(5) What happens at a feast?

subdomains.name: Manner of eating
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words describing the manner in which a person eats.
questions: (1) What words refer to eating before others?
(2) What words refer to tasting a little food to see if it tastes good?
(3) What words refer to eating a little?
(4) What words refer to eating a lot?
(5) What words refer to eating fast?
(6) What words refer to eating more than your share?
(7) What words refer to eating two things together?

subdomains.name: Hungry, thirsty
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being hungry or thirsty.
questions: (1) What words refer to being hungry?
(2) What are the symptoms of hunger?
(3) What words refer to being thirsty?
(4) What words refer to how much you can eat or want to eat?
(5) What words refer to not wanting to eat?

subdomains.name: Satiated, full
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being full of food.
questions: (1) What words refer to being full of food?
(2) What words describe food that makes you feel full?

subdomains.name: Drink
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to drinking.
questions: (1) What general words refer to drinking?
(2) What words describe the manner in which a person can drink?
(3) What words refer to what is drunk?
(4) What expressions are used to ask for a drink?
(5) What expressions are used to offer a drink?

subdomains.name: Eating utensil
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to eating utensils.
questions: (1) What words refer to the utensils used to cut and move food?
(2) What words refer to a dish for food?
(3) What words refer to a dish for drinking?
(4) What utensils are used for catching spilled food?
(5) What words refer to the utensils used by one person?
(6) What words refer to preparing the table for eating?

subdomains.name: Fast, not eat
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to fasting--to not eat for a period of time.
questions: (1) What words refer fasting?
(2) What words refer to different kinds of fasts?
(3) What words refer to stopping a fast?

subdomains.name: Types of food
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to types of food.
questions: (1) What words refer to major types of food?
(2) What words describe whether something can be eaten or not?
(3) What words describe food?

subdomains.name: Food from plants
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to food from plants.
questions: (1) What words refer to plants that can be eaten?
(2) What words refer to a person (or animal) who only eats plants?

subdomains.name: Food from seeds
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to food from seeds.
questions: (1) What general words refer to seeds that are eaten?
(2) What types of grain are eaten?
(3) What types of nuts are eaten?
(4) What types of beans are eaten?
(5) What other types of seeds are eaten?

subdomains.name: Food from fruit
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to food from fruit.
questions: (1) What types of fruit are eaten?

subdomains.name: Food from vegetables
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to food from vegetables.
questions: (1) What types of vegetables are eaten?
(2) What types of gourds are eaten?

subdomains.name: Food from leaves
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to food from leaves and stems.
questions: (1) What types of leaves are eaten?
(2) What types of stems are eaten?

subdomains.name: Food from roots
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to food from roots.
questions: (1) What types of roots are eaten?

subdomains.name: Food from animals
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to eating meat and to types of animals that are eaten. Only include those animals that are commonly eaten, especially those that are domesticated.
questions: (1) What words refer to a person (or animal) who only eats meat?
(2) What types of animals are eaten?
(3) What types of birds are eaten?
(4) What types of fish are eaten?
(5) What types of reptiles are eaten?
(6) What types of insects can be eaten?
(7) What words refer to honey and other insect products that can be eaten?
(8) What types of small animals are eaten?
(9) What words refer to eating human flesh?

subdomains.name: Meat
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to meat and types of animals that are eaten. Only include those animals that are commonly eaten.
questions: (1) What general words refer to meat?
(2) What words refer to different types of meat?
(3) What words refer to fat?
(4) What words refer to cartilage and other hard parts that are not eaten?

subdomains.name: Milk products
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to milk products.
questions: (1) What types of milk products are eaten?

subdomains.name: Egg dishes
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to food made from eggs.
questions: (1) What words refer to egg dishes?

subdomains.name: Cooking ingredients
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words referring to ingredients--the things that are added together when preparing food.
questions: (1) What general words refer to ingredients?
(2) What words refer to thickeners?

subdomains.name: Sugar
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to sugar.
questions: (1) What words refer to sugar?
(2) What words describe something that has sugar in it?
(3) What words refer to putting sugar in food?
(4) What containers are used for sugar?

subdomains.name: Salt
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to salt.
questions: (1) What words refer to salt?
(2) What containers are used for salt?

subdomains.name: Spice
subdomains.description: Use this domain for spices--things that are added to food to make them taste better.
questions: (1) What general words refer to spice?
(2) What types of spices are there?
(3) What words refer to adding spice to food?
(4) What words describe food to which spice has been added?

subdomains.name: Leaven
subdomains.description: Use this domain for leaven--things that are added to food to make them ferment.
questions: (1) What words refer to leaven?
(2) What words refer to adding leaven to food?
(3) What words refer to what happens to food when leaven is added?

subdomains.name: Cooking oil
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to cooking oil.
questions: (1) What words refer to oil used in cooking?
(2) What seeds are used to make oil?

subdomains.name: Prepared food
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to prepared food. Cultures vary widely in the number and types of foods they prepare, and in how they classify them. For instance the English distinction between main dish and side dish is not found in the classification system of other languages. If your language has well-recognized subcategories, you can set up a separate subdomain for each. The questions below are based on the main ingredient in the dish.
questions: (1) What general words refer to prepared food?
(2) What words refer to a major class of prepared food?
(3) What general words refer to a food made primarily from meat?
(4) What types of foods are made primarily from meat?
(5) What foods are made primarily from staple foods?
(6) What types of bread are there?
(7) What foods are made primarily from fruit?
(8) What foods are made primarily from vegetables?
(9) What foods are made primarily from leaves and stems?
(10) What words refer to foods that contain a lot of water and are boiled?
(11) What types of condiments are there (foods that people only eat a little of, because they are expensive, strong tasting, or are added to other foods to flavor them)?
(12) What words refer to sweet foods?
(13) What foods are eaten away from home (for instance on a journey or at work)?

subdomains.name: Prohibited food
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words that describe food that is prohibited by the culture or religion. Do not list the foods that are prohibited.
questions: (1) What words describe food that is prohibited?
(2) What words describe food that is not prohibited?

subdomains.name: Beverage
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to things people drink.
questions: (1) What general words refer to things people drink?
(2) What types of drinks are there?

subdomains.name: Alcoholic beverage
subdomains.description: Use this domain for types of beverages containing alcohol.
questions: (1) What general words refer to alcoholic beverages?
(2) What types of alcoholic drinks are there?
(3) What words refer to how much alcohol is in a beverage?

subdomains.name: Alcohol preparation
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to making alcoholic beverages.
questions: (1) What words refer to making alcoholic beverages?
(2) What are the steps in brewing?
(3) What foodstuffs are used to make alcohol?
(4) What equipment and materials are used to brew alcohol?

subdomains.name: Drunk
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to drinking alcohol and the effect it has on a person.
questions: (1) What words refer to drinking alcohol?
(2) What words refer to someone who drinks a lot of alcohol?
(3) What words refer to the effect alcohol has on a person?
(4) What words refer to the aftereffects of being drunk?
(5) What words refer to a drinking establishment?

subdomains.name: Tobacco
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to using tobacco.
questions: (1) What words refer to tobacco?
(2) What methods of using tobacco are there?
(3) What tools are used to smoke or chew tobacco?
(4) What words refer to a person who smokes tobacco?
(5) What affect does tobacco have on a person?
(6) What is produced by smoking tobacco?
(7) What does tobacco contain?

subdomains.name: Narcotic
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to narcotics and drugs that are not used as medicine but as stimulants. Narcotics are often addicting and harmful to a person's health.
questions: (1) What general words refer to narcotics?
(2) What types of narcotics are there?
(3) What words refer to taking drugs?
(4) What tools are used to take drugs?
(5) What words refer to a person who takes drugs?
(6) What words refer to a dosage of drugs?
(7) What affect do drugs have on people?
(8) What words refer to being addicted to drugs?
(9) What words refer to the need for drugs?
(10) What words describe a drug that makes people addicted?

subdomains.name: Stimulant
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to stimulants--substances that are drunk, eaten, or chewed to make a person more alert or give him more energy.
questions: (1) What general words refer to stimulants?
(2) What types of stimulants are there?

subdomains.name: Clothing
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to clothing.
questions: (1) What general words refer to clothing?
(2) What words describe clothing?

subdomains.name: Men's clothing
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to men's clothing.
questions: (1) What words refer to pieces of men's clothing?

subdomains.name: Women's clothing
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to women's clothing.
questions: (1) What words refer to pieces of women's clothing?

subdomains.name: Traditional clothing
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to traditional clothing.
questions: (1) What general words refer to traditional clothing?
(2) What words refer to different kinds of traditional clothing?

subdomains.name: Clothes for special occasions
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to special clothes worn on special occasions. It is necessary to think through all the various special occasions in the culture and think of any special clothes worn on those occasions. Two examples are given below for work and graduation, but there are many others.
questions: (1) What general words refer to clothes worn on a special occasion?
(2) What special clothes are worn for work?
(3) What special clothes are worn for graduation?

subdomains.name: Clothes for special people
subdomains.description: Use this domain for special clothes worn by special people. It is necessary to think through all the various special types of people in the culture and think of any special clothes worn by them. Several examples are given below, but there are many others.
questions: (1) What special clothes are worn by police or soldiers?
(2) What kinds of uniforms are there?
(3) What special clothes are worn by religious people?
(4) What special clothes are worn by the king?
(5) What special clothes are worn by doctors?

subdomains.name: Parts of clothing
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to parts of clothing.
questions: (1) What words refer to parts of clothing?
(2) What words refer to parts of shoes?
(3) What words refer to parts of hats?
(4) What things are used to hold parts of clothes together?

subdomains.name: Wear clothing
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to wearing clothing.
questions: (1) What words refer to wearing clothing?
(2) What words refer to putting clothing on?
(3) What words refer to taking clothing off?
(4) What words refer to not wearing a piece of clothing?

subdomains.name: Naked
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being naked--not wearing any clothes, and for words referring to how a person feels about being naked. It is a part of universal human experience that people do not want to be naked. So there are words that refer to feeling bad if one does not have enough clothes on (shame). Other words refer to wanting to have enough clothes (modest). Other words refer to how people feel about other people who do not wear enough clothes (indecent).
questions: (1) What words refer to being naked?
(2) What words refer to not wearing enough clothes?
(3) What words refer to not wanting to be naked?
(4) What words refer to feeling bad if you are naked?

subdomains.name: Style of clothing
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to clothing styles.
questions: (1) What words describe the style of your clothing?

subdomains.name: Adornment
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to adornment.
questions: (1) What general words refer to making yourself look better?
(2) What general words refer to things people put on themselves in addition to clothes?

subdomains.name: Jewelry
subdomains.description: Use this domain for objects such as jewelry that are put on or attached to the body or to the clothes as decoration.
questions: (1) What words refer to jewelry?
(2) What words refer to types of jewelry?
(3) What words refer to jewelry worn on the hands and arms?
(4) What words refer to jewelry worn on the legs?
(5) What words refer to putting on or having on jewelry?

subdomains.name: Cosmetics
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to cosmetics--things you put on your skin to make yourself beautiful in appearance.

(2) What words refer to types of cosmetics?
(3) What words refer to putting on cosmetics?
(4) What words refer to having cosmetics on?
(5) What words describe someone who is wearing cosmetics?

subdomains.name: Fire
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words that refer to fire and for words referring to types of fire. These words may be specific for what is being burned (forest fire 'a fire burning a forest'), the size of the fire (inferno 'a very large hot fire'), or the place where the fire burns (hellfire 'the fire in hell').
questions: (1) What general words refer to a fire?
(2) What types of fire are there?
(3) What words refer to what is being burned?
(4) What words refer to the size of the fire?
(5) What words refer to where the fire is?
(6) What words refer to a fire started by accident?
(7) What words refer to a fire started on purpose?
(8) What words refer to deliberately burning something?
(9) What words refer to the crime of burning someone's house or field?
(10) What words describe something that burns easily?
(11) What words describe something that will not burn?

subdomains.name: Light a fire
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to lighting a fire.
questions: (1) What words are used of a person starting a fire?
(2) What words refer to something beginning to burn?
(3) What things are used to start fires?
(4) What materials are used as kindling?

subdomains.name: Tend a fire
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words that refer to tending a fire--to keep a fire burning so that it burns well and does not go out.
questions: (1) What words refer to keeping a fire burning?
(2) What words refer to adding fuel to a fire?
(3) What words refer to blowing on a fire to make it bigger?
(4) What words refer to making a fire bigger?
(5) What words refer to restarting a fire that has died down?
(6) What words refer to keeping a fire from going out, such as covering a fire with ashes to keep it from going out during the night?
(7) What words refer to taking something out of a fire?
(8) What words refer to something taken out of a fire?
(9) What words refer to a person who is responsible to make sure the fire does not go out?
(10) What words refer to sharing fire with a neighbor whose fire has gone out?
(11) What things are used to carry fire?
(12) What tools are used to tend a fire?

subdomains.name: Extinguish a fire
subdomains.description: Use this domain for all the ways a person can stop a fire.
questions: (1) What words refer to a fire stopping?
(2) What general words are used of a person stopping a fire?
(3) What words are used of stopping a fire with water?
(4) What words are used of stopping a fire by blowing on it?
(5) What words are used of stopping a fire by covering it?
(6) What words refer to a person whose job is to stop fires?
(7) What equipment is used to stop a fire?

subdomains.name: Burn
subdomains.description: Use this domain for verbs that are used of fire: "The fire is ____." In some languages there are verbs for what is happening to the thing that is burning: "The house is ____."
questions: (1) What words refer to a fire burning?
(2) What words describe a fire that is burning well?
(3) What words describe a fire that is not burning well?
(4) What words describe a fire that starts to burn again after having died down?
(5) What words describe the appearance of fire?
(6) What words refer to a fire burning something?
(7) What words refer to something burning partly?
(8) What words refer to something burning completely?
(9) What words refer to a fire making something hot?
(10) What words refer to something burning?
(11) What words describe something that has been burned?

subdomains.name: What fires produce
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the things that fires produce.
questions: (1) What do fires produce?
(2) What words refer to a fire giving off something?
(3) What words refer to smoke?
(4) What do sparks do?
(5) What sounds do fires make?
(6) What words refer to wood after it has been burning?
(7) What is left behind by a fire?
(8) What words refer to the material that is left on things near a fire?
(9) What words refer to an area of ground that has been burned?

subdomains.name: Fuel
subdomains.description: Use this domain for types of fuel and for words used in making, collecting, storing, or using fuel. This domain includes the scenario of collecting firewood.
questions: (1) What words refer to the thing that is burned by a fire?
(2) What types of things are normally used as fuel?
(3) What words refer to firewood?
(4) What words refer to collecting fuel?
(5) What words refer to charcoal?
(6) What words are used for making charcoal?
(7) What words refer to liquid fuel?
(8) What containers are used to hold liquid fuels?

subdomains.name: Fireplace
subdomains.description: Use this domain for any place where fires are normally burned.
questions: (1) Where do people light fires?
(2) What are the parts of a fireplace?
(3) What are the parts of a stove?
(4) What are the parts of a candle?
(5) What are the parts of a lamp?

subdomains.name: Cleaning

subdomains.name: Clean, dirty

(2) What words describe something that is dirty?

subdomains.name: Posture

Use the domains in this section for specific words for postures and for moving parts of the body. Many of these words have two meanings. One meaning is stative, indicating that the body is in a particular posture, but not moving. The other meaning is active, indicating that the person is moving his body into a particular posture. Some of these words can be used of animals or even things, if the things are perceived as being similar in posture to that of a human body.

subdomains.name: Bow
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to bowing to someone--to face someone and lower your head or bend at the waist so that your upper body is lowered. The words in this domain should all be symbolic acts, that is, the culture assigns a meaning and significance to the physical action. Some cultures define it as a greeting, as an act of respect, or as an act of submission. For instance in ancient middle eastern culture bowing was an act of submission done in the presence of the king. Failure to bow was an act of rebellion punishable by death. In far eastern culture it is a greeting. In African culture it is an act of respect or done to welcome a visitor. Cultures define how a person is to bow, for instance how they are to hold their hands. A person may bow while standing, or may kneel, or even prostrate himself flat on his face. Whether both people bow is also significant. The depth of the bow can have significance. In Japan the person of lower social rank must bow deeper. In European culture a performer bows to acknowledge applause.
questions: (1) What words refer to bowing?
(2) What words describe how a person bows?
(3) What words indicate the significance of the bow?

subdomains.name: Move
subdomains.description: Use this domain for intransitive verbs of movement referring to moving your whole body to a different location. There are many components of meaning involved in verbs of movement. They can include a source location (from), a goal location (to), a path (along), manner (walk, run), speed (race, crawl), direction (forward, back, side, up, down, toward, away from), shape of the path (straight, curve, circle, angle), relationship to some object or objects (on, hang, against, between, across, through, into, out of, onto, off of, around), proximity (near, far), multiple movements (back and forth, return, bounce), inclusion with other objects or parts of objects (join, leave, collect, disperse, unite, separate), volition (go versus drift), intransitive versus transitive (move versus move something). Some verbs of movement do not involve moving from one place to another, but express bodily movement.
questions: (1) What general words refer to moving your body to a different location?
(2) What words refer to beginning to move?
(3) What words describe something that is moving?

questions: (1) What words refer to more than one thing moving in the same direction?
(2) What words refer to more than one thing moving away from each other?
(3) What words refer to more than one thing moving toward each other?
(4) What words refer to more than one thing meeting?
(5) What words refer to the place where things come together?
(6) What words refer to more than one thing moving around in a place?

subdomains.name: Simple, complicated
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to being simple or complicated--words describing the organization of a group of things.
questions: (1) What words describe something that is simple?
(2) What words describe something that is complicated?
(3) What words refer to making something simpler?
(4) What words refer to making something more complicated?
(5) What words describe a simple connection between two things?
(6) What words describe a complex connection between two things?

subdomains.name: Put
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to putting something somewhere.
questions: (1) What words refer to putting something somewhere?

subdomains.name: Load, pile
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to putting lots of things on something.
questions: (1) What words refer to putting lots of things on something?

subdomains.name: Fill, cover
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to filling a container or covering an area with something.
questions: (1) What words refer to filling something?
(2) What words refer to covering something?

subdomains.name: Hide
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to hiding things so that they cannot be seen or found, and for hiding oneself.
questions: (1) What words refer to hiding something?
(2) What words describe something that is hidden?
(3) What words refer to the place where something is hidden?
(4) What words refer to hiding yourself?
(5) What words refer to coming out from hiding?

subdomains.name: Search
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to searching for something that has been hidden or lost.
questions: (1) What words refer to searching for something?
(2) What words refer to the act of searching for something?
(3) What words refer to seeing something that you have been looking for?
(4) What words refer to looking for something and not seeing it?

subdomains.name: Find
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to finding something that has been hidden or lost.
questions: (1) What words refer to finding something that has been hidden?
(2) What words refer to learning the location of something?

subdomains.name: Lose, misplace
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to putting something in a place and not being able to find it again, or for when someone else moves something without your knowledge so that you cannot find it.
questions: (1) What words refer to losing something?

subdomains.name: Physical impact
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words referring to making a physical impact on something, including the words for the action itself and the result of the action.
questions: (1) What general words refer to making an impact on something?
(2) What words refer to the effect on the object?

subdomains.name: Hit
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to hitting something.
questions: (1) What words refer to one thing hitting another?
(2) What words refer to a person hitting something?
(3) What words refer to hitting another person?
(4) What words refer to hitting something with your fist or hand?
(5) What words refer to hitting something with a tool?
(6) What words refer to hitting two things together?
(7) What words refer to striking someone in order to cause injury?
(8) What words refer to striking something repeatedly?
(9) What words refer to each time something is hit?
(10) What words refer to the speed or force with which something is hit?
(11) What words describe hitting something with not much force?
(12) What words describe hitting something with a lot of force?
(13) What words refer to two things moving so that they hit each other?
(14) What words refer to something hitting and then bouncing?

subdomains.name: Aim at a target
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to aiming at a target, and for hitting or missing the target.
questions: (1) What words refer to aiming at a target?
(2) What words refer to hitting a target?
(3) What words refer to missing a target?
(4) What words refer to the target?
(5) What words refer to the center of a target?
(6) What words refer to a person who is good at hitting a target?

subdomains.name: Kick
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to kicking--to hit something with your foot. The words in this domain may be distinguished by the way in which the foot moves, either in a swinging motion, or by first bending the leg and then quickly straightening it. They may also be distinguished by whether the foot moves horizontally or vertically, whether the effect is to move something or damage it, or how hard the person kicks.
questions: (1) What words refer to kicking something?

subdomains.name: Press
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to pressing something.
questions: (1) What words refer to pressing something?

subdomains.name: Rub
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to rubbing--to move something smooth against something else, in order to make it smooth or clean.
questions: (1) What words refer to rubbing something?
(2) What words refer to rubbing something to make it clean?
(3) What words refer to rubbing something to make it smooth?
(4) What tools and materials are used to rub something?

subdomains.name: Grind
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to grinding--to rub something rough against something else, while applying force, in order to break it or remove its surface.
questions: (1) What words refer to grinding something?

subdomains.name: Mark
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to making a mark on something.
questions: (1) What words refer to making a mark on something?
(2) What words refer to a mark on something?

subdomains.name: Divide into pieces
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to dividing something into parts or pieces, perhaps with the added idea of using care, or into a certain number of parts.
questions: (1) What words are used of dividing something into parts?

subdomains.name: Break
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring breaking something into pieces, perhaps with the added idea of doing it accidentally or without being careful.
questions: (1) What words refer to something breaking?
(2) What words refer to breaking something?
(3) What words refer to breaking something into many small pieces?
(4) What words describe something that has been broken?
(5) What words refer to breaking through a barrier?
(6) What words refer to a container like a bag, bottle, or bubble breaking because there was too much inside?
(7) What sounds do things make when they break?
(8) What words describe something that is easily broken?
(9) What words describe something that is not easily broken?

subdomains.name: Crack
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to a crack--a partial break in something that does not entirely divide it in pieces.
questions: (1) What words refer to a crack?

subdomains.name: Cut
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to cutting something.
questions: (1) What general words refer to cutting something?
(2) What words refer to cutting something with one slice?
(3) What words refer to cutting something with many slices?
(4) What words refer to cutting something into many pieces?
(5) What words refer to cutting something with a swinging motion?
(6) What words refer to cutting something with a particular tool?
(7) What words refer to a cut?

subdomains.name: Tear, rip
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to tearing or ripping something.
questions: (1) What words refer to tearing something?

subdomains.name: Make hole, opening
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to making a hole or opening in something.
questions: (1) What words refer to making a hole in something?
(2) What words refer to an opening?

subdomains.name: Dig
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to digging in the ground.
questions: (1) What words refer to digging?
(2) What words refer to a hole dug in the ground?
(3) What tools and machines are used to dig?
(4) What words describe the size of a hole in the ground?
(5) What words refer to putting something in a hole and covering it up?

subdomains.name: Break, wear out
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to something breaking or wearing out, especially for things that people make and use.
questions: (1) What words refer to something breaking?
(2) What words describe something that has broken?
(3) What words refer to something wearing out?
(4) What words describe something that is worn?
(5) What words describe something that has been used so much that it is no longer useful?

subdomains.name: Damage
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to damaging something--to do something bad to something, but not completely ruin it so that it can't be used any more.
questions: (1) What words refer to damaging something?
(2) What words refer to deliberately damaging something?
(3) What words refer to something being damaged over a long period of time?
(4) What words refer to using something for a long time until it is damaged?
(5) What words refer to the act of damaging something?
(6) What words refer to the damage done to something?
(7) What words refer to a person who damages things?
(8) What words refer to something that damages things?
(9) What words describe something that damages things?
(10) What words refer to something that has been damaged?
(11) What words describe something that has been damaged?
(12) What words describe something that can be damaged easily?

subdomains.name: Tear down
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to tearing down buildings and other structures.
questions: (1) What words refer to tearing something down?

subdomains.name: Destroy
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to destroying something--to damage something so that it is beyond repair and cannot be used.
questions: (1) What words refer to destroying something?
(2) What words refer to something being destroyed?
(3) What words refer to the act or process of destroying something?
(4) What words refer to someone or something that destroys things?
(5) What words describe someone of something that destroys things?
(6) What words refer to something that has been destroyed?
(7) What words describe something that has been destroyed?

subdomains.name: Repair
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to repairing something.
questions: (1) What words refer to repairing something?

name: States
description: Use this domain for general words refer to the state or condition of something.
questions: (1) What general words refer to the state or condition of something?
(2) What words indicate the state that something is in?

subdomains.name: Quantity
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words referring to the amount or quantity of something.
questions: (1) What words refer to the amount of something?
(2) What words refer to the amount of something that can be counted?
(3) What words refer to the amount of food that someone is given?
(4) What words refer to a measured amount of something?
(5) What words refer to the amount of something, such as fuel, that is available to be used?
(6) What words refer to the amount of medicine that a sick person needs?
(7) What words refer to the amount of a problem such as crime or damage?

subdomains.name: Number
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to numbers. Every language has a word for 'one', and a word for 'two'. These two numbers often have special words. So we have included a separate domain for 'one' and 'two'. In addition the numbers form a series (one, two, three...). Most languages have more than one series of numbers (first, second, third...). So we have also included a domain for each series of numbers that most languages have. Your language may have other series of numbers. Put them in the domain 'Number series'.
questions: (1) What words refer to a written number?
(2) What words refer to a number of people or things?
(3) What words describe different kinds of numbers?
(4) What words refer to writing numbers on a series of things?
(5) What words indicate that there are a particular number of something?

subdomains.name: Cardinal numbers
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the cardinal numbers (one, two, three)--the numbers used to count.
questions: (1) What are the cardinal numbers? (the numbers you use when you count)
(2) multiples of ten
(3) multiples of one hundred
(4) multiples of one thousand
(5) numbers larger than one thousand
(6) What words are used to refer to the numbers of a certain decimal place?
(7) What words are used to refer to groups of a certain decimal place?
(8) What words refer to a very large number?
(9) What words refer to an unlimited number?

subdomains.name: One
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the number one. It appears that every language has a word for 'one' and 'two', but not every language has a word for the numbers higher than two. Many languages have several words that mean 'one'.
questions: (1) What words refer to one?
(2) What words refer to being by yourself?
(3) What words refer to doing something by yourself?
(4) What words refer to people doing something one by one?
(5) What words indicate that something happens or is done one time?

subdomains.name: Two
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the number two.
questions: (1) What words refer to two?
(2) What words refer to two people who do things together?
(3) What words refer to two things that are used together?
(4) What words refer to something used by two people?
(5) What words refer to something with two parts?
(6) What words refer to something used for two things?
(7) What words indicate that something is two times the amount of something else?
(8) What words indicate that something happens or is done two times?

subdomains.name: Ordinal numbers
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the ordinal numbers (first, second, third)--the numbers used to indicate the order of something in a series, such as "the first child".
questions: (1) What are the ordinal numbers?

subdomains.name: Number of times
subdomains.description: Use this domain for numbers that refer to the number of times something happens or is done. These numbers may be adverbs as in English (twice) or in some languages they may be verbs (to do something two times).
questions: (1) What words indicate the number of times something has happened? ("He fell down three times.")
(2) What words describe something that has happened a particular number of times?
(3) What words refer to doing something a particular number of times (to do something once/twice/etc.)?

subdomains.name: Multiples
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to multiples of something (single, double, triple).
questions: (1) What words describe something that is two or three times the amount of something else?
(2) What words indicate that something is two or three times the amount of something else?
(3) What words refer to something becoming two or three times as much?
(4) What words refer to making something become two or three times as much?

subdomains.name: Numbered group
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a group of a particular number of things or people (solo, duo, trio; alone, in threes).
questions: (1) What words refer to a group of a particular number?
(2) What words indicate that only one person does something?
(3) What words refer to a group of two?
(4) What words refer to a group of three?
(5) What words indicate that something is done in groups of a certain number?
(6) What words indicate that everyone is to get a certain number of something?

subdomains.name: Fraction
subdomains.description: Use this domain for the numbers that refer to a fraction of something.
questions: (1) What general words refer to a fraction of something?
(2) What words refer to a particular fraction of something?
(3) What words refer to dividing something into a fraction of the whole?

subdomains.name: Number series
subdomains.description: Use this domain for other series of numbers that are different from those in the previous domains.
questions: (1) What words refer to something made up of a certain number of parts?

subdomains.name: Count
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to counting--to say the numbers in order, or to use numbers to find an amount.
questions: (1) What words refer to saying the numbers in order?
(2) What words refer to counting the number of something?
(3) What words refer to determining the amount of something without being exact?
(4) What words refer to determining the quantity of something a second time?
(5) What words refer to making a mistake when you count?
(6) What words refer to the number or amount of something that is counted?
(7) What words refer to assigning a number to each thing in a series?
(8) What words describe an amount that cannot be counted?

subdomains.name: Mathematics
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to mathematics and arithmetic--the study of numbers.
questions: (1) What words refer to mathematics?
(2) What words refer to determining the amount of something?
(3) What words indicate the answer in an equation?
(4) What words refer to the answer to a mathematical problem?
(5) What words are used to talk about mathematics?
(6) What words refer to a person who studies mathematics?
(7) What instruments are used to do mathematics?

subdomains.name: Add numbers
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to adding two numbers together.

(2) What words refer to adding a series of numbers?
(3) What words are used for addition equations?
(4) What words indicate the answer in an equation?
(5) What words refer to the total?
(6) What words indicate that a particular number is the total?
(7) What words indicate that the number of a group of things reaches a particular total?

subdomains.name: Subtract numbers
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to subtracting one number from another.
questions: (1) What words refer to subtracting one number from another number?
(2) What words are used for subtraction equations?
(3) What words indicate the answer?
(4) What words refer to the answer?

subdomains.name: Multiply numbers
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to multiplying one number times another.
questions: (1) What words refer to multiplying one number times another?
(2) What words are used for multiplication equations?
(3) What words indicate the answer?
(4) What words refer to the answer?

subdomains.name: Divide numbers
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to dividing one number by another number.
questions: (1) What words are used of dividing one number by another number?
(2) What words are used for division equations?
(3) What words indicate the answer?
(4) What words refer to the answer?

subdomains.name: Plural
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words and affixes that indicate that there is more than one of something. Some languages, such as Indo-European languages, indicate plural with an affix. Other languages, such as Austronesian languages, use a separate word. Some languages also have words or affixes that indicate that there are two of something.
questions: (1) What words indicate that there is more than one of something?
(2) What words indicate that there are two of something?

subdomains.name: Many, much
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words indicating that there are many things or people, or that there is much of something.
questions: (1) What words indicate that there is a large amount of something?
(2) What words indicate that there are a large number of things or people?
(3) What words indicate that there are a very large number of things or people?
(4) What words indicate that many things are happening?
(5) What words indicate that many bad things are happening?
(6) What words indicate that many people are doing something?
(7) What words describe something that many people are doing?
(8) What words indicate that someone does something a lot?
(9) What words describe something that contains a lot of a particular substance?
(10) What words describe someone who makes many things?
(11) What words refer to using or giving a lot of something?
(12) What words describe a large number or amount?
(13) What words describe a very large number or amount?

subdomains.name: Few, little
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related there being few or little of something.
questions: (1) What words indicate that there is a small amount of something?
(2) What words indicate that there is a very small amount of something?
(3) What words indicate that there are a small number of things or people?

(7) What words refer to a small amount of money?
(8) What words refer to a small number of people that are part of a larger group?
(9) What words indicate that few people are doing something?
(10) What words refer to using or giving a little of something?

subdomains.name: Group of things
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words that refer to a group of things.

(2) What words refer to a group of things that belong together?
(3) What words refer to a group of things that are tied or joined together?
(4) What words refer to a group of things that are put on top of each other?
(5) What words refer to a group of things that are moved together?
(6) What words indicate that something is a member of a group?

subdomains.name: More
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to there being more of something.

(2) What words indicate an amount that is more than an amount already mentioned?
(3) What words describe something that is more than another thing in number or amount?
(4) What words indicate that the actual number is more than a particular number?
(5) What words refer to something being more than a particular number or amount?

(2) What words indicate that something is less than a particular number or amount?
(3) What words indicate that there is much less of something?
(4) What words indicate that something is less in some quality than another thing?
(5) What words indicate that something happens less or is done less?

subdomains.name: Increase
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to something increasing in number or amount--to be more than before.
questions: (1) What words refer to something increasing in number or amount?
(2) What words describe something that is increasing in number or amount?
(3) What words refer to increasing a lot?
(4) What words refer to increasing very quickly?
(5) What words refer to increasing slowly?

(4) What words refer to decreasing slowly?
(5) What words refer to a decrease in number or amount?
(6) What words refer to a quality becoming less?

(8) What words describe something that someone is doing or feeling less than before?
(9) What words refer to causing something to decrease?

(11) What words refer to reducing pain or a bad feeling?

subdomains.name: All
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to all.
questions: (1) What words refer to all of a group of things?

(3) What words refer to all of what you want?

subdomains.name: Some
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to some--a number or amount of things or people when the number is not stated; an indefinite number or amount.

subdomains.name: None, nothing
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words that nothing, no one, never, and nowhere.

(2) What words refer to not any of a number of things?
(3) What words refer to no person?
(4) What words refer to no time?
(5) What words refer to no place?
(6) What words refer to the number zero?

subdomains.name: Both
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to both of two things.
questions: (1) What words refer to both of two things?

subdomains.name: Most, almost all
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to most--more than half and less than all of something.
questions: (1) What words refer to most of something?
(2) What words describe something that is done by most people?
(3) What words indicate that most of a group is of one kind.
(4) What words indicate that something happens or someone does something more than anything else?

subdomains.name: Most, least
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to the most--the largest number or amount; or the least--the smallest number or amount. Most/least may refer to the largest/smallest number possible or needed. If there are several groups being counted, most/least may refer to the largest/smallest group.
questions: (1) What words refer to the largest amount of something?
(2) What words refer to the smallest amount of something?
(3) What words refer to the largest group?
(4) What words refer to the smallest group?
(5) What words refer to an amount being the largest it has ever been?
(6) What words refer to an amount being the smallest it has ever been?

subdomains.name: Almost
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to a number or amount that is almost the same as another number.
questions: (1) What words indicate that something is almost a particular number or amount?
(2) What words indicate that someone has almost reached a place?
(3) What words indicate that something has almost reached a particular state?
(4) What words indicate that something is almost finished?
(5) What words indicate that someone almost does something?
(6) What words indicate that something almost happens?
(7) What words indicate that something is almost the best or worst example of some quality?
(8) What words indicate that something is so similar to something that it is almost the same thing?
(9) What words indicate that something is almost some quality (such as some color or shape)?
(10) What words indicate that something is true of or has happened to almost all of something?

subdomains.name: Only
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words referring to only a particular number or amount of people or things--no more than one, or no more than a particular number or amount.
questions: (1) What words describe the only person or thing?
(2) What words indicate that there is only a particular number or amount of something?
(3)  What words indicate something is true of only one thing or one group of things, and not true of others?
(4) What words indicate that something is only what you say it is, and not something more?

subdomains.name: Exact
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words that indicate whether a number or amount is exact--not more and not less.
questions: (1) What words describe a number or amount that is exact?
(2) What words indicate that a number or amount is exact?
(3) What words indicate that something happens at an exact time?
(4) What words indicate that something happens at an exact place?
(5) What words describe something that is exactly the same as another thing?
(6) What words indicate that something is done in exactly the right way?

subdomains.name: Approximate
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words that indicate whether a number or amount is approximate.
questions: (1) What words describe a number or amount that is approximate?
(2) What words describe something that is not exact?
(3) What words indicate that a particular number or amount is approximate?
(4) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly more?
(5) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly less?
(6) What words refer to determining the approximate number of amount of something?
(7) What words refer to estimating a number to the nearest ten, hundred, thousand, etc?
(8) What words refer to a number that is approximate?
(9) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate time?
(10) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate place?
(11) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?
(12) What words indicate that something is done in approximately the right way?
(13) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?

subdomains.name: Average
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words related to an average number.
questions: (1) What words refer to an average number?
(2) What words describe an average number?
(3) What words refer to calculating the average?

subdomains.name: Whole, complete
subdomains.description: Use this domain for words describing a whole thing--all of something with no parts missing.
questions: (1) What words indicate that something is whole?
(2) What words refer to making something complete?
(3) What words indicate that something is not whole?

subdomains.name: Part
subdomains.description: Many things have parts. Use this domain for words referring to a part of something, and for words that express the idea that something has parts, that something is a part of something, or that link the whole with a part.
questions: (1) What words refer to a part of something?
(2) What words refer to the parts that something is made from?
(3) What words refer to the parts of a process?
(4) What words refer to the parts of an organization?
(5) What words refer to the parts of a story?
(6) What words refer to the parts of a situation?

questions: (1) What words refer to an indefinite location?

subdomains.name: Direction
subdomains.description: Use this domain for general words referring to a direction.
